title: How To Align Images Side By Side

content.text: How TO - Align Images Side By Side
Learn how to align images side by side with CSS.
content.html: Learn how to align images side by side with CSS.

content.text: How To Place Images Side by Side

content.code_html:
<div class="row">
  <div class="column">
    <img src="img_snow.jpg" alt="Snow" style="width:100%">
  </div>
  <div class="column">
    <img src="img_forest.jpg" alt="Forest" style="width:100%">
  </div>
  <div class="column">
    <img src="img_mountains.jpg" alt="Mountains" style="width:100%">
  </div>
</div>

content.text: How to create side-by-side images with the CSS float property:
content.html: How to create side-by-side images with the CSS float property:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* Three image containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */

syntax_highlighting.text: /* Three image containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */

content.code_html:
/* Three image containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
.column {
  float: left;
  width: 33.33%;
  padding: 5px;
}

/* Clear floats after image containers */
.row::after {
  content: "";
  clear: both;
  display: table;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* Three image containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */

content.text: How to create side-by-side images with the CSS flex property:
content.html: How to create side-by-side images with the CSS flex property:

content.code_html:
.row {
  display: flex;
}

.column {
  flex: 33.33%;
  padding: 5px;
}

content.text: Note: Flexbox is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 and earlier versions. It is up to you if you want to use floats or flex to create a three-column layout. However, if you need support for IE10 and down, you should use float.
content.html: Note: Flexbox is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 and earlier versions. It is up to you if you want to use floats or flex to create a three-column layout. However, if you need support for IE10 and down, you should use float.

content.text: Tip: To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter .
content.html: Tip: To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter.

content.text: Optionally, you could add media queries to make the images stack on top of each other instead of floating next to each other, on a specific screen width.
content.html: Optionally, you could add media queries to make the images stack on top of each other instead of floating next to each other, on a specific screen width.

content.text: The following example will stack the images vertically on screens that are 500px wide or less:
content.html: The following example will stack the images vertically on screens that are 500px wide or less:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - makes the three columns stack on top of each other 
  instead of next to each other */

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - makes the three columns stack on top of each other 
  instead of next to each other */

content.code_html:
/* Responsive layout - makes the three columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */
@media screen and (max-width: 500px) {
  .column {
    width: 100%;
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
/* Responsive layout - makes the three columns stack on top of each other 
  instead of next to each other */

content.text: To learn more about media queries, read our CSS Media Queries Tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about media queries, read our CSS Media Queries Tutorial.

content.text: To learn more about how to style images, read our CSS Images Tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about how to style images, read our CSS Images Tutorial.

content.html: To learn more about CSS Float, read our CSS Float Tutorial.

content.html: To learn how to create an image gallery with CSS, read our CSS Image Gallery Tutorial.
